dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, Netflix just dropped its Q1 earnings, and you know, everyone's kinda watching them right now with all these new streaming services popping up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, uh, Netflix just dropped its Q one earnings, and you know, everyone's kinda watching them right now with all these new streaming services popping up.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Netflix reported record 9.6 million subscribers in the quarter that ended in March.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, absolutely. I mean, Disney+, Apple TV+ – it's a crowded market. But from what I read, Reed Hastings isn't really sweating it, is he?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, absolutely. I mean, Disney plus, Apple T V plus - it's a crowded market. But from what I read, Reed Hastings isn't really sweating it, is he?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But Netflix CEO Reed Hastings isnt letting the competition see him sweat.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: No, not at all, actually. He, uh, he pretty much acknowledged them as "world-class brands" but said he doesn't anticipate them materially affecting Netflix's growth.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, not at all, actually. He, uh, he pretty much acknowledged them as world-class brands but said he doesn't anticipate them materially affecting Netflix's growth.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The big dog of Internet TV acknowledged the new competitors as world-class consumer brands whose forthcoming services would be a boon to consumers and content creators alike. But Netflix CEO Reed Hastings isnt letting the competition see him sweat. We dont anticipate that these new entrants will materially affect our growth because the transition from linear to on-demand entertainment is so massive and because of the differing nature of our content offerings, Hastings wrote Tuesday in an investor letter that accompanied Netflix's first quarter earnings release.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's a bold statement, considering the buzz around Disney. [interrupts] Like, Star Wars alone is huge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a bold statement, considering the buzz around Disney. Like, Star Wars alone is huge.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? But his argument is that the whole shift from linear TV to on-demand is just so massive, there's, like, plenty of room for everyone. And their content is just different.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? But his argument is that the whole shift from linear T V to on-demand is just so massive, there's, like, plenty of room for everyone. And their content is just different.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We dont anticipate that these new entrants will materially affect our growth because the transition from linear to on-demand entertainment is so massive and because of the differing nature of our content offerings, Hastings wrote Tuesday in an investor letter

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Huh, okay. Well, I guess their numbers for Q1 do back that up a bit. They reported a record 9.6 million new subscribers, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huh, okay. Well, I guess their numbers for Q one do back that up a bit. They reported a record nine point six million new subscribers, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Netflix reported record 9.6 million subscribers in the quarter that ended in March.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, a huge chunk of that, um, 7.86 million, actually came from outside the U.S. So that global expansion strategy is really paying off.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, a huge chunk of that, um, seven point eight six million, actually came from outside the U S. So that global expansion strategy is really paying off.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Much of that growth7.86 million subscriberscame outside the U.S.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But then the stock dipped a little after hours because of slower Q2 growth forecasts. Was that the U.S. price hike kicking in?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then the stock dipped a little after hours because of slower Q two growth forecasts. Was that the U S price hike kicking in?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The company forecast slower growth in the second quarter, prompting the stock to drop nearly $5 a share in after-hours trading to $354.60.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. They, uh, they confirmed the rate increase in the U.S. is moderating growth a bit this spring.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. They, uh, they confirmed the rate increase in the U S is moderating growth a bit this spring.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This guidance takes into account the impact Netflix's rate increase in the U.S., which is moderating growth in the spring quarter, the company said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, they're seeing the competition, but also raising prices. That's a confident move. And they're really pushing their originals now, aren't they?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, they're seeing the competition, but also raising prices. That's a confident move. And they're really pushing their originals now, aren't they?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, totally. Hastings was, like, touting "The Umbrella Academy" getting 45 million households, and "Triple Frontier" with 52 million. Big numbers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, totally. Hastings was, like, touting The Umbrella Academy getting forty five million households, and Triple Frontier with fifty two million. Big numbers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Umbrella Academy, a series based on the comic book by Gerard Way and Gabriel Bá, which has been watched in 45 million households in its first four weeks on service, he said. Viewers in 52 million homes grabbed the popcorn to watch the action/heist movie Triple Frontier, starring Ben Affleck and directed by J.C. Chandor.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, those are, um, really impressive figures. And it's not just the big Hollywood stuff either. They're doing a lot with local content.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, those are, um, really impressive figures. And it's not just the big Hollywood stuff either. They're doing a lot with local content.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, like adapting "Nailed It!" for Mexico, France, Spain. And "¡Nailed It!: México" actually got three times more first-month watchers than the dubbed US version.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, like adapting Nailed It! for Mexico, France, Spain. And Nailed It! México actually got three times more first-month watchers than the dubbed U S version.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is adapting its lighthearted cooking competition Nailed It! for Mexico, France, Germany and Spain. ¡Nailed It!: México has achieved three times more first-month watchers in Mexico than the dubbed US version, Hastings said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's incredible! And, uh, "Kingdom," their Korean original, was a huge success too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's incredible! And, uh, Kingdom, their Korean original, was a huge success too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The service also premiered it first large scale Korean original series, Kingdom , in January. This period piece with zombies is our most successful season one show in Korea to date and has also been watched by millions of members outside of Korea, Hastings said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Ted Sarandos, their Chief Content Officer, even said that all their top 10 shows are Netflix original brands now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Ted Sarandos, their Chief Content Officer, even said that all their top ten shows are Netflix original brands now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The top 10 show are all Netflix original brands, said Chief Content Officer Ted Sarandos.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So it's all about, like, creating these exclusive, global stories. That's their play against Disney's huge IP.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So it's all about, like, creating these exclusive, global stories. That's their play against Disney's huge I P.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. They're saying there's ample appetite, and they only satisfy a portion of it. Hastings thinks Netflix is only about 10% of total TV usage in the US.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. They're saying there's ample appetite, and they only satisfy a portion of it. Hastings thinks Netflix is only about ten percent of total T V usage in the U S.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Netflix represents only about 10% of total TV usage in the U.S., its most mature market, Hastings noted, and there's more room to grow around the world.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, they're just gonna keep growing their own pie, even as the overall pie gets bigger with new players. Interesting strategy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, uh, they're just gonna keep growing their own pie, even as the overall pie gets bigger with new players. Interesting strategy.
